page.title: 17HOUSES - AROUND COUSLAND
page.content: THERE ARE MANY DIFFERENT HOUSE TYPES IN THIS AREA. FORMER FARM COTTAGES OR MINERS' COTTAGES HAVE BEEN RENOVATED AND EXTENDED TO MAKE MODERN FAMILY HOMES. SEVERAL LARGE FARM HOUSES ARE STILL OCCUPIED BY FARMING FAMILIES. A NEW ESTATE OF 45 HOUSES WAS BUILT IN COUSLAND VILLAGE IN 1975-6. THE STREETS OF DALRYMPLE, STUART AND CRANSTON WERE NAMED AFTER LOCAL PEOPLE. THE 200 YEAR OLD NORTH LODGE, IN OXENFOORD ESTATE, WAS ONCE OCCUPIED BY THE GREAT, GREAT GRANDFATHER OF A FAMILY, WHO HAVE NOW BOUGHT THE DERELICT HOUSE, TO CONVERT IT ONCE AGAIN INTO A FAMILY HOME. THE RESIDENTS OF HILLSIDE COTTAGES HAVE BEEN LIVING IN PATHHEAD FOR SIX WEEKS, WHILE THEIR HOUSES ARE BEING RENOVATED-NEW BATHROOM, KITCHEN, HEATING, WINDOWS AND INSULATION.
